comments:
Hey Brian,

I'm assigning this to you because you probably know what the problem is off the top of your head.  Basically, I'm seeing a NPE in the CN framework.  Looks like it's related to the action priority.  Not sure what we need to do w.r.t. DTP as DTP is supposed to support Eclipse 3.2.

The stack trace is below.

Rob

Should have also mentioned that this prevents the DSE from displaying (hence the blocker severity).

Ok.  I tracked this down to the sample connection profile plugin.

John, is it OK if this plugin does not support 3.2?  If so, we can close this out as WONTFIX.

Rob

Hey Rob...

If that's where the issue lies, then this has to do with the examples I put in overriding the Refresh menu.

Should we put together a 3.2 sample vs. a 3.3 sample?

--Fitz

A couple of points here:
1. Let's make sure this is still an issue in Eclipse 3.2.2, since that is the declared supported platform. Eclipse 3.2.1/3.2.2 probably doesn't matter, but just to be sure.

2. The sample cp can specify plug-in version tolerances to make it 3.3 or 3.2.2 specific as necessary. If required separate samples for 3.2.2 and 3.3 would be fine.

I don't have a problem with simply documenting this in the plugin.xml (i.e. the following is only supported in 3.3. If you get errors loading the DSE, comment this out).

My assumption is that this plugin is not included in the build and can only be acquired directly from the CVS repository.

Rob

Made three changes:

1. Added a readme to the sample indicating how to make it 3.2 compatible
2. Added comments to the plugin.xml for the two areas that need to be commented/removed to work in 3.2
3. Changed the required version of Eclipse to 3.3 for the sample.

Delivered changes. Should appear in tomorrow's build.
Since this impacts only the sample cp plug-in, which is not in the DTP 1.5 build, then the DTP 1.5 build snap shot will not be moved forward. The updated src is available from CVS.
